intro: Neodunnia longeracemosa, commonly known as the long-branch dunnia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Neodunnia longeracemosa is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodland edges and stream banks.
